intro: Ephippium lepidum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Ephippium lepidum is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields.
